question: What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations
prompt:
Reminder: The original question was:
What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations

Nice plan, please go ahead!
next_plan: I have completed the full computational pipeline: discovery, model formulation, network construction for both homogeneous and degree-heterogeneous contact structures, parameter fitting for matched R0, stochastic simulations using the SEIR model on both networks, and outcome metrics extraction (epidemic size, duration, peak time, and size). The next steps are: (1) synthesize all findings into a thorough scientific report in LaTeX format, including detailed comparative analysis, figures, tables, discussion, and references; (2) provide mathematical/analytical explanation for the difference in dynamics using degree moments and mean-field theory, and relate to results; (3) incorporate all model and reasoning details into the writeup. The next completion will generate the paper in raw LaTeX code as required, ready for PDF compilation.
